title: Why did Stalin refuse to exchange his own son for Hitler's nephew when he must have known this would result in his death? - Quora

response.answer_text: As was already said, Paulus was the field Marshall who surrendered the German VI Army at Stalingrad. Of no relation to Hitler. In Stalin, court of the Red Tsar, a Georgian confidant asked if there was any truth about the story of him not exchanging Yakov. “He ‘hung his head,” answering “in a sad, piercing voice”: ‘Not a myth… just think how many sons ended in camps! Who would swap them for Paulus? Were they worse than Yakov? I had to refuse… What would they have said of me, our millions of party fathers, if having forgotten about them, I had agreed to swapping Yakov? No, had no right…”

The Germans offered to exchange Stalin’s son for Field Marshall Paulus not “Hitler’s nephew” (Hitler had no siblings who survived childhood). Since Stalin considered all captured Red Army members to be “willful traitors to the Motherland” he did not exchange his son who committed suicide in a German POW camp.
